topic: Deep dive: audioop standard library module in Python 3.12+
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: Deep dive: audioop standard library module in Python 3.12+

response_parsed.title: Deep Dive: Audioop Standard Library Module in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This explainer delves into the Audioop standard library module available in Python 3.12+, focusing on its key functionalities and usage.
key_points: Audioop is a standard library for audio signal processing in Python 3.12+
It offers various functions for reading, writing, and manipulating audio data
Supports different audio formats like WAV (waveform format), AIFF (audio interchange file format), and raw audio files
Includes functions for audio effects such as amplify, reverse, and convolve

code_examples.code:
import wave

wav_file = wave.open('input.wav', 'r')
wav_file.setparams((wav_file.getsampwidth(), wav_file.getcomptype(), wav_file.getcompname(), wav_file.getframerate(), wav_file.getnchannels()))
wav_data = wav_file.readframes(wav_file.getnsamples())
wav_file.close()

import wave

wav_file = wave.open('output.wav', 'wb')
wav_file.setparams((wav_file.getsampwidth(), wav_file.getcomptype(), wav_file.getcompname(), 10000, wav_file.getnchannels()))
wav_file.writeframes(b'amplified audio data')
wav_file.close()

version_notes: Audioop became a part of the Python standard library in version 3.12
Previous versions had a third-party implementation named 'pydsp' which is now replaced by Audioop
caveats: Not all functions in Audioop are backward compatible with previous versions of Python and pydsp
Ensure that the required audio formats are properly installed on your system before using Audioop
